bibl.title: Phoenix from the Ashes: The Burnt Archive from Petra.
bibl.note: Henry Russel Lecture at the University of Michigan, March 12, 1996. - The archive, found in a Byzantine church at Petra, contains 152 rolls of carbonized documentary papyri (VIth century). - I. Petra and the Nabataeans. - II. The Burnt Papyri and their Conservation. - III. The Subject Matter of the Archive. - IV. The Agriculture in Petra's Hinterland. - V. Houses. - VI. Petra in the Sixth Century. - VII. The Use of the Arabic and Greek Languages in the Sixth Century. - VIII. The End of Petra?
bibl.seg: KOENEN Ludwig, Phoenix from the Ashes: The Burnt Archive from Petra.

Henry Russel Lecture at the University of Michigan, March 12, 1996. - The archive, found in a Byzantine church at Petra, contains 152 rolls of carbonized documentary papyri (VIth century). - I. Petra and the Nabataeans. - II. The Burnt Papyri and their Conservation. - III. The Subject Matter of the Archive. - IV. The Agriculture in Petra's Hinterland. - V. Houses. - VI. Petra in the Sixth Century. - VII. The Use of the Arabic and Greek Languages in the Sixth Century. - VIII. The End of Petra?
